column2: COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country. All travellers over the age of 12 must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test result when entering Aruba. The test must have been carried out no more than 24 hours before departure. A health screening and temperature check will be carried out on arrival. Further information on testing and screening is available on the website of the Government of Aruba .
column3: Self-isolation at own accommodation- subject to PCR. You can also choose to take a COVID-19 test, for a fee, on arrival in Aruba, but a mandatory quarantine period of 24 hours is required for all visitors who choose to be tested on arrival. Those who test positive for COVID-19 during their stay will be required to self-isolate. Please see this website for further information.
column5:
Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*Entry to Aruba: You must get approval to travel to Aruba through the embarkation/disembarkation card online before arrival. Visit the website of the Government of Aruba for the latest information on entry requirements.
*Testing/Screening on arrival: All travellers over the age of 12 must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test result when entering Aruba. The test must have been carried out no more than 24 hours before departure. A health screening and temperature check will be carried out on arrival. Further information on testing and screening is available on the website of the Government of Aruba.
The public health authorities of Aruba also advise you to download the Aruba Health App on your smart phone prior to your travel. This is to assist you and inform you about COVID-19 measures and instructions in Aruba. See the website of the Government of Aruba for more information about the Aruba Health App.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Aruba: The Government of Aruba has put measures in place in response to the coronavirus pandemic. such as the mandatory wearing of face masks in all public indoor spaces. All measures and updates can be found on thewebsite of the government of Aruba .
